column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=I have often observed, that the Women, living
#Text=near these Work-houses, complain of hysteric Passions, occasioned by the noisome Smell, which
#Text=some may wonder at, upon the Consideration that
#Text=sharp-smelling Things, applied to the Nostrils, are
#Text=recommend ed by Hippocrates as a Remedy for
#Text=hysteric Fits.
#Text=But as on the one hand sweet-scented
#Text=Things do not always excite hysteric Fits, in regard that Cinnamon, Nutmegs and such like odoriferous Things are Remedies against them, which
#Text=Horatius Augenius cries up as infallible, and
#Text=
#Text=which Etmuller does not condemn, and as Hippocrates recommends the sweetest scented Wine, in
#Text=his Book de Nat.
#Text=Mul.
#Text=So on the other hand
#Text=Things of an unsavoury Smell are not always proper to check their Fits, as Forestus has well observed ; and it is an ansient Observation, that the
#Text=Snuff of a Lamp raises hysteric Commotions.
#Text=And
#Text=therefore I do not wonder that the animal Spirits
#Text=are put into disorderly Motions by the putrid Smell
#Text=of Tallow ; and that thereby the Uterus suffers
#Text=Convulsions along with the Stomach, which is forced
#Text=upwards by the Nauseousness of the Smell.
#Text=Nay I
#Text=have oftentimes seen Women of a tender, nice
#Text=Constitution, fall into fainting Fits and hysteric
#Text=Commotions upon using the Light of a Tallow-
#Text=candle.
#Text=To be further satisfied of the pernicious Smell of
#Text=Tallow-candles do but consult Solenander who
#Text=informs you, that his Brother John contracted a
#Text=violent Disorder in his Lungs and his Brain by studying hard by the Light of Tallow-candles.
#Text=He
#Text=adds, that Ox-tallow gives a more noisome Smell
#Text=than that of Sheep : But in our Country we find
#Text=that the Tallow-candles never smell so rank, as
#Text=when some Hogs-tallow is one of the Ingredients.
